instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
Hello i got problem on my board in area of <SIGNAL>P3V3_SSD_EN_L</SIGNAL>. When <TRANSISTOR>Q8072</TRANSISTOR> is on place i get ground on this line. is it correct ? got orginal ssd mac didnt find it ,but when i use transcend ssd mac see him...

<CHIP>U3740</CHIP>
1- 3,4
2-0,02
3-3,32
4-0
6-3,33
7-0,03
8-0

ssd in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
"i got problem on my board in area of <SIGNAL>P3V3_SSD_EN_L</SIGNAL>"
What this means exactly?
Do you talk about voltage, or diode mode?

As per its name, <SIGNAL>P3V3_SSD_EN_L</SIGNAL> MUST be 0V in working condition.

So other SSD works good, original is not detected?
Did you try one more?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full"]60136[/ATTACH] 
this line in diode mode is grounded,is it correct? no voltage 
orginal ssd is 100% working because in my macbook air is working. when i put it to this mac he start spinning but no chime,or sometimes mac chime but  dont see this ssd and show that there is now ssd on screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
"this line in diode mode is grounded,is it correct? no voltage"
Impossible to understand.
If you talk about grounded, that can ONLY be seen checking in diode mode, or ohm scale; do NOT do that with power applied.
Getting 0V doesn't mean is grounded; don't you get 0V on other non-grounded points?
Or any 0V points means to be connected to ground???

However, already explained that 0V is correct voltage for  <SIGNAL>P3V3_SSD_EN_L</SIGNAL>; the end "L" says this!
How else can <TRANSISTOR>Q8070</TRANSISTOR> work?
Do you get <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
Then post all <TRANSISTOR>Q8070</TRANSISTOR> voltages.
Be sure no short to ground on its output.
Remember to always check with SSD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R8070</RESISTOR>; change it, if broken.

BTW, did you see any reason to check voltage for each pins, when they are tied together?
Not good enough to check only one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8070</RESISTOR> is 33k and seems to be ok 
1-3,3
2-3,3

BTW you right but i never before ask for help and do all as good as i can so sorry ...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message: sorry now its 3,3 i change <TRANSISTOR>Q8072</TRANSISTOR> at morning

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
Get back 0V there; that is the correct voltage!
Re-check what you've done changing <TRANSISTOR>Q8072</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
Post actual <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> voltages.
Remember to keep SSD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message:
All voltages look good now.

Is the SSD detected in Disk Utility?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't see internal SSD
threads.message: ok now its working. thx a lot and sorry
